src:
台風１９号　車で移動中流され犠牲　福島県川内村・工事宿舎から 避難判断難しく

03 Nov 2019, 20:00



木戸川（手前）が氾濫し、道路が崩落した現場。奥は横山さんの所在が最後に確認された事務所兼宿舎（３日、川内村下川内で）

　台風１９号で行方不明となり、２日に福島県川内村下川内の水田で遺体で見つかった福島市の横山純一さん（６９）は、車で避難しようとした際に木戸川の氾濫に巻き込まれたとみられている。県内では一連の台風・大雨で３３人が亡くなっているが、少なくとも９人が車で移動中に被災。横山さんや相馬市で犠牲になった母子は雨が強まった後の避難で犠牲になっており、判断の難しさを浮き彫りにしている。
　関係者によると、横山さんは建設会社「安藤ハザマ」東北支店の社員として、同村の事務所兼宿舎（プレハブ２階建て）に泊まり込んで村内のトンネル工事に従事。台風１９号が接近していた１０月１２日夜も事務所にいて、午後８時頃、上司に「川が増水してあふれている。どうしよう」と電話をかけてきた。上司は「外に出るのは危ないから２階でじっとしていた方がいい」と伝え、横山さんは「わかった」と答えたという。
　ただ、その約３０分後、横山さんは「避難するぞ」と同僚の男性に声をかけて事務所の外に出た。男性が荷物の準備をして事務所の外に出た時には、既に横山さんの姿はなかったという。
　福島地方気象台によると、１１日午後３時から１３日午前６時までの川内村の総雨量は、県内最大の４４５・５ミリを記録。事務所前の木戸川が氾濫した。事務所１階は床上浸水し、車７台が川に流された。
　事務所と川の間の道路は約１０メートルにわたって片側が崩落し、横山さんの車は数十メートル下流で、道路脇のガードレールにひっかかった状態で発見された。遺体が見つかった水田もすぐ近くだったという。
　上司の男性は読売新聞の取材に「まじめで責任感の強い社員だった。あの時、事務所を出ないようにもっと強く言っておけばよかった」と話した。
text:
Typhoon No. 19 was moved by car and sacrificed. Difficult to judge evacuation from Kawauchi Village and construction dormitory in Fukushima Prefecture.

03 Nov 2019, 20:00



A site where the Kido River (front) flooded and the road collapsed. Behind the office and dormitory where Mr. Yokoyama was confirmed last (3 days in Shimokawachi, Kawauchi)

Junichi Yokoyama (69) of Fukushima City, who was missing in Typhoon No. 19 and found in a paddy field in Shimokawachi, Kawauchi-mura, Fukushima Prefecture, was involved in the flooding of the Kido River when he tried to evacuate by car. It is believed. In the prefecture, 33 people were killed by a series of typhoons and heavy rains, but at least 9 people were affected by the car while moving. Ms. Yokoyama and her mother and child who were sacrificed in Soma City were sacrificed by the evacuation after the rain became strong, highlighting the difficulty of judgment.
According to the person concerned, as a member of the Tohoku branch of the construction company “Ando Hazama”, Mr. Yokoyama stayed at the office and dormitory in the village (prefabricated 2 stories) and engaged in tunnel construction in the village. At the evening of October 12, when Typhoon No. 19 was approaching, I was in the office and called my boss, “The river is overflowing and overflowing. The boss said, “It ’s dangerous to go outside, so it ’s better to stay still on the second floor,” Yokoyama said.
However, about 30 minutes later, Mr. Yokoyama called out to his colleague man and said, “I will evacuate.” When the man went out of the office to prepare his luggage, Yokoyama was not already there.
According to the Fukushima Local Meteorological Observatory, the total rainfall in Kawauchi Village from 3 pm on the 11th to 6 am on the 13th is the largest in the prefecture, 445.5 mm. The Kido River in front of the office overflowed. The first floor of the office was flooded on the floor, and seven cars were swept into the river.
The road between the office and the river collapsed for about 10 meters on one side, and Yokoyama's car was found tens of meters downstream and caught on a guardrail beside the road. The paddy field where the body was found was also nearby.
“The man in the boss told the Yomiuri Shimbun,“ I was a serious and responsible employee. At that time, I should have said more strongly not to leave the office. ”
